name: tim
text: this is one of my favorite strips - i have a signed copy of the alternate-punchline version

name: ttagxamm
text: Which is here , since Acheworld doesn't seem to link to it...

name: i_love_kate
text: Ooh, I remember this version! But yeah, the new one is better.

name: ttagxamm
text: New url for the original version: Voila!

name: deimosrising
text: Ray is the sort of man who can recognize his flaws. He is willing to grow and learn.

name: nice-on-merlot
text: He is willing to state that he has been meaning to grow and learn

name: dezufnocosem
text: someone give this to their geometry teacher and expect nothing less than an A

name: everything_is_a_hat
text: damn I wish I knew about this comic when I was still in high school learning geometry.

name: autrepoupee
text: A comment left by autrepoupee was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, ishuta, VictoriaW)

name: catgrl131
text: What shirt is that?

name: autrepoupee
text: I swear such a shirt used to exist, and I used to pine away for it.  I can't find it in the shop anymore, though. Boooo!

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Yes, it exists; my friend (about to get her PhD in Math Education) has it in green. I think she got it as one of those "close out/limited supply" sales that Onstad did a few times last year. He tends to bring some older shirts back into production every once in a while, so it might return.

That reminds me: I really wish Chris would make some of the logos on the shirts (with centered logos on the front) a little smaller. I like that Dude & Catsrophe shirt, and the Todd crest, but the logos just look too big for my taste. I'm thinking a little closer to the Cartilage Head logo.

Maybe he's afraid that images won't work if they're too small, I dunno.

name: nice-on-merlot
text:
I own that shirt.
Love it.
Green.

name: anomalous3
text: Geometry is like a gun. Use acute angles to protect yourself.

name: havenless
text: You'd think Roast Beef would at least crack a smile when doing something he likes.

name: dj
text: No, it's pretty darn Roast Beef-esque to enjoy yourself with "sad eyebrows" and a frown.

name: dusty
text: It is pretty accurate; when people enjoy themselves at intellectual tasks they usually do not smile while they do them.

name: history
text: Thank you!  I cannot tell you how many times I have people ask me if I am sad, when I am simply thinking about something.

name: dusty
text: That does happen often, interrupting me when I'm in deep thought, but to be positive about it at least it means you have someone who cares if you seem to be sad.

name: history
text: Great thought.  Something to be grateful for in my life.  Sometimes I get so involved with what is going on in my own head I forget.  Thanks.

name: wharfrat
text: the why do you drink so much at night ray....why...

name: lizjones
text: Maybe if Ray learned some geometry, his pool game wouldn't be a melted down chili pepper nailed to a board.

name: especial
text: lesser panda!

name: thicker
text: A comment left by thicker was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, madnes, Overmedicated, equinn2006, Conn, cheeks_jd, SPECTRE)

text: how do you know he didn't also write "Fuck Geometry?"  "...Algebra" was just the album title.

text: I guess there are all types of things that people don't know

text: A comment left by spectre was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tetrisattack, ralgnar, STUART)

name: closefriend
text: Beef is too depressed to put an argument after his tangent function, or use the angles he was given or the area to use Heron's formula to find the length of the 3rd side.

name: luckyg
text: It would be much easier if he just used the Pythagorean theorem.

name: closefriend
text: Neither of those are right triangles.

name: heccibiggs
text: Ohhhhh geometry burn

name: cthulhu235
text: Damn, check out Beef standing his ground.

name: gormster
text: In the second panel Beef is trying to find the length of the base of a Toblerone.

name: lawbot
text: A comment left by lawbot was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, LaserBlade, ralgnar)

name: streever
text:
He has that one available, too, and has since 2002. If you go to the comic WITHOUT assetbar, you will see a link to it. The problem is that assetbar does not allow for his clever linking....

"censored" ha ha ha ha ha ha ha you think Onstad censors Achewood? That is pretty silly.

text: i think it's more subtle this way

name: deovalente
text: Forty-five degress.

text: A comment left by steerpike66 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by fakead, theplaidknight, bixschmix, hawaiian_robot, libelandslander)

name: tekende
text: *GROAN*

name: shoinan
text: Be thankful that Assetbar won't let me lame you because that pun surely deserved one.

name: jezebel
text: Basically, Roast Beef is extremely awesome.

name: solobuttons
text: What the fuck. I totally don't remember this strip, but it is so damn good.

name: donnatron
text: Do you think geometry is rad, Roast Beef?

name: professorriffs
text: Achewood was particular golden around this time.  Lots of Level 5 Beefs going on around here.

name: origotoshi
text: My interpretation of this strip is that Roast Beef reminded Ray of his alleged "surgery" with that comment. Hence the shocked expression, then the change to an accepting attitude. He's trying to play it off, and make it look like he's not missing out on use, due to not having something.

name: carlyle
text: Man, fuck geometry. It just sucks!
